alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:13AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Callahan, northern Brown and northern Coleman Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 312 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eula, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rowden around 345 AM CDT. Cross Plains and Atwell around 400 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Us- 283 Near The Coleman- Callahan County Line, Echo, Admiral, Lake Coleman and I- 20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 309 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
